Package sandbox

Class Rectangle

java.lang.Object
sandbox.Rectangle
public class Rectangle extends Object
A rectangle represents an area in a matrix specified by the upper left corner of the rectangle and the lower right corner of the rectangle.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Rectangle()
    Default constructor.
    Rectangle(int x, int y, int x1, int y1)
    Constructs a rectangle out of the coordinates represented by x, y, x1, and y1.
    Rectangle(Point upperLeft, Point lowerRight)
    Constructs a rectangle out of the two coordinates specified by the Points upperLeft and lowerRight.

  • Constructor Details

    • Rectangle

      public Rectangle()
      Default constructor. creates an empty rectangle

    • Rectangle

      public Rectangle(int x, int y, int x1, int y1)
      Constructs a rectangle out of the coordinates represented by x, y, x1, and y1. x and y is the upper left corner. x1 and y1 is the lower right corner. required: x < x1 y < y1
      Parameters:
      x - the coordinate of the upper left corner on the x-axis
      y - the coordinate of the upper left corner on the y-axis
      x1 - the coordinate of the lower right corner on the x-axis
      y1 - the coordinate of the lower right corner on the y-axis
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the coordinates are outside the required bounds.

    • Rectangle

      public Rectangle(Point upperLeft, Point lowerRight)
      Constructs a rectangle out of the two coordinates specified by the Points upperLeft and lowerRight.
      Parameters:
      upperLeft - the upper left corner of the rectangle
      lowerRight - the lower right corner of the rectangle

    • setLowerRight

      public void setLowerRight(Point lowerRight)
      setter for the Point that represents the lower right corner of this rectangle.
      Parameters:
      lowerRight - the Point representing the lower right corner of the rectangle
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - the lower right coordinates represented by Point must not be null, and the coordinates must be greater than the upper left coordinates.

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Rectangle rectangle)
      Determines if this rectangle is intersected by another rectangle.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - the Rectangle to test for intersection.
      Returns:
      returns true if the rectangle parameter intersects this rectangle. otherwise it returns false.

    • intersection

      public Optional<Rectangle> intersection(Rectangle rectangle)
      If two Rectangles intersect, this method returns a rectangle representing the area the Rectangles share in common.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - the Rectangle to test for and return the shared common area. If the rectangles do not intersection, then an empty Optional is returned.
      Returns:
      an Optional with s Rectangle representing the intersection, if the rectangles intersect, or an empty Optionals if not.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Rectangle rectangle)
      Determines if a rectangle is wholly contained or enclosed by this rectangle.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - the Rectangle we want to test for containment.
      Returns:
      true if the passed in Rectangle is contained by this rectangle, false if it is not.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Point pt)
      Determines if a Point falls within the area of this rectangle.
      Parameters:
      pt - the Point (coordinate) we want to use to determine if it lies within the area of this rectangle.
      Returns:
      true if the Point is within the area of this rectangle, otherwise, false.

    • adjacent

      public boolean adjacent(Rectangle rectangle)
      Determines if another Rectangle is adjacent to this rectangle. Adjacent meaning any side of the rectangle shares the same line as this rectangle, either in part or in full. for example: .................... .AAABBB............. .A.B..B............. .A.B..B............. .AAABBB............. .................... .................... Rectangle A shares its right side with Rectangle B's left side.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - the Rectangle to test to see if it shares a side with this Rectangle.
      Returns:
      true if this Rectangle shares a side with the passed in Rectangle, false if it does not.

    • build

      public static Rectangle build(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      A utility function to build a Rectangle using the coordinates of the upper left corner along with the width and the height.
      Parameters:
      x - the upper left coordinate on the x-axis
      y - the upper left coordinate on the y-axis
      width - the width of the newly created rectangle
      height - the height of the newly created rectangle
      Returns:
      the newly created Rectangle
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is less than or equal to zero
